p: Cycas micronesica has been listed on the United States Endangered Species Act (ESA) for five years [ 72]. The direction of public funds for immediate conservation projects has focused on tree rescue from construction sites rather than the known threats to species survival [ 37]. The ultimate planning for C. micronesica recovery should embrace the need to conserve all native species that rely on the tree while eradicating or mitigating the non-native biotic threats.
